foods.recipe: Biriyani is a flavorful rice dish made with aromatic spices, meat (such as chicken, beef, or mutton), and fragrant rice. The meat is marinated in a blend of spices, then cooked with partially boiled rice in layers, resulting in a rich and aromatic one-pot meal.

Fish curry is a staple dish in Bangladesh made with freshwater fish (such as Rohu, Hilsa, or Pangasius), spices, and a tangy gravy. The fish is cooked in a blend of spices, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and various aromatic herbs.

Pitha is a traditional Bangladeshi sweet or savory rice cake, typically made from fermented rice batter or ground rice flour. They come in various shapes and flavors and can be steamed, fried, or baked.

Shorshe Ilish is a famous Bengali dish made with Hilsa fish cooked in a mustard seed paste. The fish is marinated in a mixture of mustard seeds, green chilies, turmeric, and other spices, then gently simmered in a mustard gravy.
Chapati is a staple flatbread in Bangladesh made from whole wheat flour. The dough is kneaded with water, rolled into thin discs, and cooked on a hot griddle until puffed and lightly browned.

Beef Bhuna is a spicy and flavorful dish made with tender beef, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and a blend of aromatic spices. The beef is slow-cooked until tender and coated in a thick, rich gravy.

Haleem is a hearty and nutritious dish made with a mix of lentils, meat (such as chicken, beef, or lamb), and wheat. The ingredients are slow-cooked until they form a thick porridge-like consistency, which is then garnished with fried onions, mint, and lemon juice.

Kacchi Biryani is a traditional and elaborate rice dish made with marinated meat (such as mutton or beef) and basmati rice. The meat and rice are cooked together in layers, infused with aromatic spices, saffron, and ghee, resulting in a fragrant and succulent dish.

Shatkora Beef is a tangy and aromatic dish made with beef, Shatkora (a citrus fruit), and a blend of spices. The meat is slow-cooked with the tangy Shatkora, which imparts a unique and refreshing flavor to the dish.

Mishti Doi is a sweet and creamy dessert made with thickened milk, sugar, and a hint of caramelization. The milk is boiled until it reduces and thickens, then sweetened with sugar and fermented overnight to achieve its distinct sweet and tangy flavor.
